summary:
Customer-focused product manager with 15+ years’ experience in product management, digital product, content strategy, analytics and user-experience. Extensive experience in digital content delivery and monetization for web, mobile and emerging platforms. 

I craft compelling digital content experiences that work for businesses and are loved by consumers.

Core Accountabilities:

•	Collaborated with business owners to develop unique value propositions and plan a product roadmap with best-in-class products.  Communicated clearly and effectively with business owners and stakeholders to ensure consistent understanding of product direction and progress.
•	Prioritized the product backlog and managed the product through the broader product management lifecycle. Delivered features that drove customer satisfaction, ensured user-centered design was top-of-mind and product plans backed by financially sound business models.
•	Tracked product success using meaningful KPIs and qualitative analysis, integrating data from sources like Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Comscore Media Metrix and Sophi (a custom-built proprietary data tool).
•	Worked hand-in-hand with the scrum master and agile development team, delivering individual sprints on time and on budget.
•	Conducted ongoing market analysis tracking competitors, market share, user behaviour, new technologies, and content consumption. Tracked evolving customer wants and ensured products were in line with strategic goals.

Additional Responsibilities:

•	Managed vendor relationships – Ensured SLA agreements and contracts were met, expedited technical issue resolution and contract negotiation.
•	Evangelized agile methodology – promoted scrum principles and agile thinking throughout a The Globe and Mail transitioned to agile process.

profile_positions.description: Product owner responsible for Booking's Machine Learning (AI) models for content moderation (text and images) as well as supporting back end infrastructure that connect this moderation infrastructure to key business verticals.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Product Manager for a variety of stakeholders within the Globe and Mail: News and Opinion (2011-2012), News, Opinion, Features and Advertising (2013-2016). 

Dedicated application of agile product management practices to build offerings that leverage the strength of The Globe and Mailʼs editorial content as a key asset. Developed best-in-class products for the relevant content category, using a user-centered design approach  as well as a deep understanding of the productʼs current competitive position and its future potential. Created offerings that improve user experience and strengthen The Globe and Mailʼs overall design and digital editorial presence.

Effectively communicated between technical and business groups to establish a consistent understanding about the product's needs and direction.
profile_positions.title: Digital Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Strategic business advisor supporting product owners of TOPS CMS (proprietary custom-built Content Management System). Met with external clients and internal stakeholders to gather and document requirements for client sites and to drive iterative improvement of the TOPS product.

Highlights of Deliverables:

•	Produced comprehensive feature set documentation of TOPS CMS for new client acquisition.  Supported sales team as product SME.
•	Analyzed and documented client needs and defined CMS requirements for Rogers Media radio sites, Toronto Star mobile app, Chatelaine Magazine, and Toronto.com. Managed business requirements, wireframes, prototypes and other project documentation.

Core Accountabilities:

•	Maintained a strategic, competitive understanding of digital publishing trends to guide development of the proprietary CMS, which was the core business unit.
•	Defined business needs, platform requirements, UX requirements and information architecture needs through regular meetings with client business leaders and online editorial teams.
•	Informed the product roadmap, worked with scrum master and product owners to translate product backlog items into agile requirements for the CMS platform and vendor sites. 

Additional Responsibilities:
•	Provided end-user training to clients using the TOPS CMS.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Hands-on lab instructor and guest lecturer to first-year journalism students for the introductory Online Journalism course.

•	Introduced new journalists to the implications of online technology trends (Twitter, Facebook, blogging, shift to mobile consumption, social media, etc.) and the ethics, practice and business of journalism online.
•	Focused on content for online audiences, understanding the distribution impact of social media and engaging students in the potential for converged reporting, participatory journalism and interactivity.
profile_positions.title: Instructor - Journalism and New Media

profile_positions.description:
Conducted quantitative analysis of audience interactions with Canoe.ca portal products and supported Lifestyle, Entertainment and News product managers, providing insights and recommendations from web analytics and voice of customer data and optimization strategies to internal teams.

•	Responsible for competitive analysis of major players in online media in the U.S. and Canada. 
•	Identified strategic opportunities to improve the Canoe.ca Portal product and properly measure the success of those opportunities.
•	Articulated core needs and essential features for a redesigned CMS and portal product to support product managers and the development team. 
•	Defined and documented requirements for a global architecture overhaul of the CMS. 
•	Formulated information architecture and usability requirements to systematically improve and expand Canoe.ca’s user experience strategy
profile_positions.title: Online Media Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Planned and executed a product and social media strategy to launch Canoe Space, a social media platform, as a parallel vertical complimenting the Canoe.ca portal in English Canada and for the Sun Media English daily newspaper sites. Canoe Space was a pre-Facebook social media platform integrated with QMI digital properties.

•	Conducted in-depth competitive social media trend analysis and business planning for the English-language launch of Canoe Space. 
•	Grew revenue and audience for the platform, which was backed by a six-figure development budget. 
•	Planned Product roadmap and worked with developers to implement platform upgrades.
profile_positions.title: Social Media Product Manager - Canoe Space

profile_positions.description:
Editorial lead and product owner for an experimental cross-platform (television, print, newspaper) user-generated content strategy called Canoe Live. 

Highlight work delivered:

•	Editorial and product lead lead through launch of a high-value vertical within a news and entertainment portal that grew into one of the top three news portals in Canada within the next two years.
•	Experimental UGC-driven content site which delivered user-engagement and advertising revenue. One of the first sites to integrate user-generated content on their sites. 
•	Supported one of the first integrated cross-platform advertising teams in Canada (print, online and broadcast). 

Core Accountabilities:

•	Built a community of user-generated content contributors to Canoe.ca and Sun Media websites and developed strategies to successfully integrate that content across platforms (television, print and online).
•	Directed editorial staff and defined product requirements for the online version the Canoe Live, worked with design and development to implement improvements to the site.
profile_positions.title: Online Content Director

profile_positions.description:
• Met revenue and traffic goals set for the paper, successfully implemented sales strategies, educated and motivated the editorial team to participate in the online initiative.

• Sold editorial and sales operations with absolutely no online experience on the value contributing to a new and evolving online strategy.
profile_positions.title: Online Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Covered politics, education, crime, military, health, entertainment, human interest and science and technology on tight daily deadlines.

• Won the Sun Media Dunlop Awards for coverage of the friendly fire deaths of four Canadian soldiers in Afghanistan and coverage of the four RCMP officers slain in Mayerthorpe.
profile_positions.title: General Assignment Reporter
